Description: White glazed composition (faience) scarab engraved with the name of Tuthmosis III (Men-kheper-re); mould-made and glazed (now mostly vanished); the cartouche of the Pharaoh is flanked by Uraeus serpents above which are neb signs; smaller uraeii above; maat feathers on the top as well as they sign for gold; perforated for suspension.
Bibliographic references: Kenna 1971 / Catalogue of the Cypriote Seals of the Bronze Age in the British Museum (no. 90)
Jacobsson 1994 / Aegyptiaca from Late Bronze Age Cyprus (no. 249)
